physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Bilateral limbal and peripheral corneal scarring and vascularization noted.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Post cataract extraction in 1991, visual acuity decreased from 20/20 to 20/60 in the right eye and to 20/40 in the left eye.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Bilateral superior peripheral corneal vascularization with late fluorescein staining.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: During the past 3 years, visual acuity has been stable, and peripheral vascularization has not progressed.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Irregular scalloped epithelial appearance noted in both eyes.
Presence of conjunctival goblet cells on the corneal surface confirmed by impression cytology.
